results.title: Hans Heysen recollections
results.creator_credit: Reg McLean, Lion's Den Productions and Eugene Schlusser
results.brief_description: A comprehensive and personal documentary about the life of one the most renowned painters of the Australian landscape, Hans Heysen. The program centers around interviews with his surviving children, including the Archibald Prize winning artist Nora Heysen, and focuses on the regions around Hahndorf, South Australia, and the Flinders Ranges where his painting was most prolific. It provides a reflective portrayal of his artistry, his concern for the Australian environment, his wide network of supporters and friends, and his influence on others intertwined with a sensitive study of his personal history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Reg McLean, Lion’s Den Productions and Eugene Schlusser

results.title: Hans Christian Andersen. Vol. 3
results.brief_description: These adaptations of some of Hans Christian Andersen’s stories have been produced as a teaching aid for Australian schools. The presentation has been designed to enhance children’s listening and concentration skills and to inspire their imaginations. Each story is beautifully illustrated with full colour drawings. Narrator Grant Denyer’s lively storytelling comes from his experience in education and television, giving the stories a crisp easy listening feel. Volume three contains “Little tiny Thumbelina”, “The brave tin soldier”, “The money box” and “A brief history of Hans Christian Andersen”.

results.title: Hannibal : the terror of Rome
results.creator_credit: Caligard Film, Fernsehproduktions GmbH and Heiner Stadler
results.brief_description: This film delves into the multi-faceted and mysterious figure of Hannibal, who time after time escaped from the Roman military machine and was therefore idealised and demonized by his enemies like no other man. Aerial photography, computer animation, interviews with military experts and historians, and an expedition using elephants reveal how Hannibal was able to overcome Rome’s natural defensive barrier - the snowy, ice-covered Alps.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Caligard Film, Fernsehproduktions GmbH and Heiner Stadler

results.title: Hannah and the dog ghost
results.brief_description: A folktale about Hannah, a young widow who lives with her son in Texas at the turn of the century. When her son is stolen by an evil fiddle man, Hannah rescues him after a series of adventures in which she is aided by a mysterious dog. Stars Vickie Washington.

results.title: Hanimex movie editor and accessories
results.brief_description:
“8mm Editor Viewer Volt 220 - 240V 18W AC 50&60Hz Lamp 6V 10W 0.2amp Made in Japan by Sansei Koko Ltd ‘For super-8, single-8 and normal 8. 100 x 75 mm colour corrected fresnel lens. Winding brake system Geared rewind Two stage sprocket wheel. Power cord attached (250V miniature cord Tatsuta, Japan N-516-777). Australian plug: Clipsal, 250V 10A 439 series Kelvin brand film reel case with film reel inside. There is a blue biro label (very faint now) which reads: MOON FILM No.35. There is a date and subject label which has been left empty..

Hanimex E400 Movie Editor Operating Instructions Foam storage base Box of Equipment 2 bulbs: Hosobuchi brand 6V 10W (Japan) 2 black plastic circles Film cement bottles: Filmkitt film cement (glass bottle - plastic lid) colle p. films Made in Germany Johnson Universal film cement (glass bottle - plastic lid) Made in England yellowed bottle and inner 25cc Size Inflammable Johnsons of Hendon Ltd Purchased from Jack Leate. Camera stores Reliable film cement for slicing both non-inflammable and inflammable cine films. M&B ‘Tricoid’ safety film cement. (glass bottle - plastic lid) Suitable for Triacetate film. Scrape surfaces, coat thinly with cement and press together for a few seconds. Avoid breathing vapour. T. 5/31/89. 28cc size 1fl. oz”

results.title: Hangman
results.creator_credit: Les Goldman, Melrose Productions and Paul Julian
results.brief_description: Follows Maurice Ogden’s allegorical poem. A hangman executes the inhabitants of a tow, one by one, without explanation. Fed by the blood of the victims no-one defended - the alien, the one who dared to object, and the Jew - the gallows tree takes root and fills the village square. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
